refnamediv.refpurpose: Script to select and download a Kirby kit

refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: This manual page documents briefly the &dhpackage; command, which is part of the kirbytools1 package.

&dhpackage; is a script that will download a Kirby package from Github to your local machine. You can choose between the starterkit and the plainkit package and you can select the version which should be downloaded. You can also specify the directory where the package will be downloaded to.

Optionally, you can force the download even if a package of the same kit and version is already on your local machine, and you can ask to extract and install only the kirby program directory to a specific directory used for symbolic links of the same directory in a given virtual host installations directory.

Default values for these options will be set by the kirbyconfigure1 script, which will be called upon first invocation of any of the kirbytools scripts. The values will be saved in the file $HOME/.kirbyrc.

refsect1.title: OPTIONS
refsect1.para: The script follows the usual GNU command line syntax, options always starting with a dash (`-').

listitem.para: Extract the kirby program directory of the downloaded kit to a folder with kirby program directories. The location defaults to the value of KIRBYLIBDIR (appended with the versionnumber), which has been configured by the kirbyconfigure1 script and which is saved in the file $HOME/.kirbyrc.

This makes sense if you would like to create multiple virtual hosts which are based on the same Kirby version. The kirby program directory will then only be linked into the virtual host folder. See the Kirby cookbook recipe about multisite installations for further details.
Force download even if the package is already downloaded. Standard behavior is to skip downloading if the package is already in KIRBYDOWNLOADDIR.
Specify which Kirby kit to download. Defaults to the value of KIRBYKIT, which has been configured by the kirbyconfigure1 script and which is saved in the file $HOME/.kirbyrc.
Specify which Kirby version to download. Defaults to the value of KIRBYVERSION, which has been configured by the kirbyconfigure1 script and which is saved in the file $HOME/.kirbyrc.
If current is selected, always the most recent version is downloaded. Otherwise a valid versionnumber has to be specified.
Specify the directory where downloads will be saved. Defaults to the value of KIRBYDOWNLOADDIR, which has been configured by the kirbyconfigure1 script and which is saved in the file $HOME/.kirbyrc.

The downloaded package is named package-version.tar.gz. Hence, the full path would be /usr/local/src/kirby/package-version.tar.gz if the variable KIRBYDOWNLOADDIR points to /usr/local/src/$KIRBYSUFFIX, and the variable KIRBYSUFFIX is defined as kirby.
The system-wide configuration file to control the behaviour of &dhpackage;.
The per-user configuration file to control the behaviour of &dhpackage;. This file will be created by the kirbyconfigure script (see kirbyconfigure1) if it does not exist.

refsect1.title: BUGS
refsect1.para: Currently, only Kirby 3 starterkits and plainkits are supported.
The programs are currently optimized to work with the apache2 httpd.
Some functionality requires root (or sudo as root) access.
